Fields.DialogueText: Look out there, Captain. Do you see those clouds brewing?
Looks like it'll be one hell of a storm.
I hope it causes more trouble for the Morganas than it will for us.

Fields.MenuText: I like to believe that nobody is immune to nature's wrath.
Probably not. I mean, they're actual monsters. I doubt they'll notice.
I'm not really sure what to expect when it comes to Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Morganas are unnatural. Perhaps they actually could be immune...
You're right. It's more likely that the storm is afraid of the Morganas.
Well, if you ask me, I think a good hurricane or two should sink even a Morgana.
Morganas certainly are fearsome opponents. We still don't have any surefire tactics for facing them.
If it was up to me, we'd be running straight into the fight, Captain!!
That's a bold move. Suits you.
I hope that's a compliment.
It might be. Don't get a big head though.
It always works for me. Face your problems head on and never back down!
Well, this time our problem is a storm.
Let's face it! And any dangers within! We should move forward without fear!
You're getting riled up. I like it.
@BATTLE
It looks like we're almost out of the storm!
And into the oven. I'm picking up some Morganas just ahead of us.
Of course. There's always more. Get ready for battle!
@BATTLE
That's wasn't too bad, right? It was actually kind of great. I've never felt so alive!
That attitude of yours is going to get us in some trouble one day.
But not today! Today we won!

Fields.MenuText: I guess you're right. We did beat those Morganas.
Barely. I was this close to losing an eye!
We won't always.

Fields.DialogueText: And there is no prize more valuable than that, right?!
You have wonderful eyes! I won't let you end up with an eyepatch - even though it would look great on you.
We will. I promise. We'll always find a way to win.
At least we're safe now. I can finally catch my breath.
You're welcome for that.
I'll admit, I'd be dead many times over without you. Thank you, Rawalpindi.
That means a lot... Thanks, Captain.
Now, let's get out of here before the storm decides to chase us.
Right! I think we could use a chance to resupply after that last battle. Let's go!
Captain, we've got Morganas in the distance on our port side.
Are they approaching? Why isn't the alarm sounding?
Because they're not moving. They're just sitting there watching us.
Hmmm… Could they be waiting for a chance to strike? Inspecting our tactics? Setting up an ambush?
Could be all the above - but it won't matter if we rush in and take them out now!
And I thought I was still the Captain.
Just making a suggestion. Obviously you're giving the final order. So give it already.

Fields.MenuText: We wait them out.
We strike hard.
We call for help.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I guess I should get ready to sit on my hands for a while.
That's my captain! They won't know what hit 'em.
You really think we need reinforcements? I can handle them!
*BOOM*
Sounds like you're not the only one itching for a fight.
See? No one likes just sitting around. It's always more satisfying to rush in.
Let's hope it's more satisfying for us and less so for them.
@BATTLE
More Morganas on approach, Captain.
Let's put a stop to them then.
@BATTLE
Phew. That was quite the pickle.
A pickle? I've actually never had one.
You don't know what a pickle is? That's almost a crime.
I know what a pickle is; I've just never eaten one. Is it really that important?

Fields.MenuText: They're one of the fundamental food groups.
Well, I think tasting everything is important. How else do you know what you really like?
Very. You need to taste them to know how disgusting they really are.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm certain that isn't true.
Well, I doubt I'll enjoy it more than chicken karahi, but I can give it a shot.
They're disgusting? Then why would I ever want to eat one?!
I'm not going to force you to eat anything you don't want to, but all this talk of food is making me really hungry.
Then let's grab something to eat. I might even try a pickle, if you try some chicken karahi.
Chicken Karahi? How do you know I haven't already had it? Maybe it's my favorite dish.
Well, if it isn't already, it's about to be.
*ALARM*
You're re-reading "The Influence of Sea Power upon History" again?
I don't think I'll stop until I run out of room to take notes in the margins.
You're a note taker, huh? Mind if I take a look?
Sure, here you go. There are a lot to choose from. Oh, I hope you can read my handwriting!
This one says, "Naval warfare revolved around technology each side possessed."
I remember that one. Basically, the side with the better technology had the advantage. So everyone was always trying to make technological advances.
And here you are with guns from the Great War.
Really? Sheesh, I must have forgotten.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry if I upset you.
You still manage to do a great job with them.
Sarcasm is not a good color on you.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not upset. We've gone over this, I'm fine with what I have.
It's actually more of a team effort. I may fire them, but you tell me where to shoot.
Oh, I'm so sorry, I'll never be sarcastic again! That was sarcasm, in case you didn't pick up on it.
So my guns are old, big deal! It just means the odds are stacked against me a little. I like being the underdog.
That's a great attitude to have, but I don't think you're the underdog. Anyone who bets against you is a fool.
Admit it, my dear Captain! You find my vintage style more charming, don't you?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain, we've got Morganas.
They're not wasting any time.
@BATTLE
The Morganas just won't leave us alone lately.
Maybe they're falling in love with me, so they follow me around. You can relate to that, can't you?

Fields.MenuText: When you put it like that, I can see what you mean.
Love is more about putting another person's wants and needs before your own.
I guess... I'm not really sure since I've never been in love myself.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly! It's kind of romantic when you think of it like that, right? In a scary way.
Hmmm... That does make sense. I probably would've thought of that if I had more experience.
You haven't? Well, that makes the two of us.
Regardless, I doubt the Morganas will keep attacking us to ask for a date.
Artillery fire would be a pretty serious form of rejection. I hope you keep those cannons stowed if anyone actually tries to ask you out.
Depends on who's asking...
*ALARM*
*BOOM*
Rawalpindi, did you hear that blast? I need a status report.
Um... one of our engines may have taken a hit.
How bad of a hit?
It could be worse! We're not sinking. From what I can tell, repairs shouldn't take long.
I don't want to stop for repairs in the middle of the open ocean. We should consider making a port call.
Preferably before the Morganas come sniffing our way? That might be wise... and I'm sorry about this, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: No need to apologize. We'd probably be dead in the water if it wasn't for you.
Apology accepted. Now let's focus on fixing it.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I mean... I am doing all I can to keep everything running.
Of course. This is my top priority, and I won't let anything distract me.
All right, you keep working on the engine. I need to go check on the injured.
That's one more thing I should apologize for.
What are you talking about?
I should've been a little more cautious in that last battle. If we hadn't taken so many hits we wouldn't have as many injured.
That wouldn't exactly be you, now would it?
You're right... I'll get back to work.
I didn't mean it as a bad thing.
Captain... we're not alone out here.
Right. I don't suppose you're actually setting up a happy surprise? A supply ship full of candy, maybe?
Well, we're almost in firing range. You tell me.
@BATTLE
There you are, Rawalpindi. I've been looking all over the ship for you. We need to go over tactics, and I can't do that without you.
Maybe you should.
That doesn't sound like you. If you're not there who's going to suggest we charge straight at the enemy?
Maybe it's best if no one suggests that.
What's going on, Rawalpindi?
I messed up, Captain. I'm thinking I need to start changing some things about myself.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I guess personal growth and change is healthy.
Don't you dare change a thing, Rawalpindi. Not a thing.
Like your clothes? I wasn't going to say anything, but...

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, that's what I keep telling myself.
Not a thing? Captain, I knew you were sweet on me!
No, not my clothes! I'm talking about changing my personality.
If this is about before, you shouldn't go changing who you are because of one setback.
If it had been another Belle in that fight, would they have gotten as damaged? How many people would've been injured on their watch?
I assure you other Belles have made mistakes as well. What's important is that you learn from your mistakes.
Thanks, Captain.
Come on, we need to discuss tactics, and I can't think of anything better to get your mind off all this.
All right... but only because you're making me...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Rawalpindi? You're in bed? Back in bed or still in bed?
Both, maybe. I'm just really tired. I need a few more hours of rest.
And what should I tell the Morganas if they come knocking while you're napping?
That I'll kill them later.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, sleep tight. Hope we don't die without you.
Take all the time you need. I hope you feel better, Rawalpindi.
Maybe I'll just hop in bed too. It does look pretty comfy.

Fields.DialogueText: You sure know how to lay on the guilt.
How can you be so nice to me? I'm literally lying down on the job!
You want to hop in this bed?! I'm... Um... That's... I...
Whatever you're thinking right now, just know that we would definitely not be better without you.
*ALARM*
Urrrrrrgggggh!
Looks like your wake up alarm is sounding.
FINE! I'm getting up. Let's go take out some Morganas.
You sure you're up for it?
You couldn't fight without me, right?
Exactly.
@BATTLE
So it's been some time. How are you feeling now? Still want to curl up in bed and hide from the world?
You're making it sound far worse than it was. I came out to fight the Morganas, didn't I?
You almost didn't though. Come on, I just want to know what's been troubling you.
I just have days sometimes, you know? I wonder if maybe I wouldn't have been better off as a merchant vessel.
Didn't we just recently spend a good amount of time keeping you on the front lines?
Most of the time, I am confident that I belong here. I know that I'm making a difference. And then there are other times... when I make mistakes...

Fields.MenuText: That's crazy, Rawalpindi. Everybody makes mistakes.
So then do you really not want to be here anymore?
If that's how you feel, then maybe the front lines really aren't for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Most peoples' mistakes don't endanger lives. I can't afford any mistakes, Captain.
Yes? No? I don't know. It's complicated, Captain.
I know what you're trying to do. You're trying to use reverse psychology on me. And it's working.
I want to keep fighting with you, I do. I just... I want to be sure that I'm not... more trouble than I'm worth.
Rawalpindi, as much trouble as you are sometimes, I wouldn't want to be fighting this war without you.
Captain... how is it you're so good at making me feel at home with just a few words?
It's a gift.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Rawalpindi, it looks like we've been assigned a new mission.
It's about time. I was getting a little bored with our patrol.
Glad to see you're in a better mood.
A big important mission is enough to make a girl forget about her troubles. So what are we doing?
HQ reports that Morganas have set up a little blockade, attacking civilian and merchant ships when they get close. Our priority is to put an end to them.
Hmmm, and here I thought I was your priority.
Oh, uh, you definitely are, it's just that this mission is---
I was joking, Captain. No reason to get all flustered.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, yeah, I got that. I was joking too.
Well, I wasn't joking. You really are that important to me.
I'm not flustered!

Fields.DialogueText: Really? So I'm not important to you?
Oh, I... Thank you, I don't know what to say.
Teasing you is too much fun, Captain!
So, what's our destination? Where's this blockade?
To the east of our current position. It shouldn't take us long to get there.
Great, let's hurry then. We need to destroy them before anymore innocent lives are lost!
That's what I like to hear. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Relax. I'm joking.
I didn't say that!
Plus, the sooner we finish... the sooner I can become your top priority again! Hah!
Or am I?
*ALARM*
Hey, Rawalpindi, I was thinking that when we finish taking care of this blockade, we could take port in India for a bit.
India? That's an exciting possibility.
Well, you mentioned chicken karahi a while ago, and I've been craving it ever since.
You've had it before?

Fields.MenuText: No, I just love chicken, and I'm always interested in a new way to eat it.
Of course. What, do you think I'm a picky eater or something?
Maybe. Honestly, I've eaten so many different meals all over the world, that I sometimes forget which are which.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... that's as good a reason to sail around the world as any I've ever heard. Sounds like a plan!
I just figured that if you really liked it, I'd have seen it on the menu once or twice.
Seriously? I'm a little jealous.
If you really want to drop by India when we're done, I know all the greatest places to eat. As long as you can handle spicy food.
I think I can take it.
Great! Sounds like a date.
A what now?
*ALARM*
Morganas. They must be looking for a beat down. Let's tear them to pieces!
A date, huh? Okay. A date it is.
@BATTLE
So, we know the Morganas are positioned along this line here. We should be able to flank them and catch them unawares if we move around this cover.
We could just coax them into open ocean and really go to town on them.
Maybe, but their ships are smaller and faster than ours. Open ocean would give them more of an advantage than us.
You're right. We'd be surrounded before we knew it. I really need to focus more on strategy so I don't make a costly blunder.
Exactly. You have any ideas you've read about in that book of yours?
Right! Let me just reread really quickly. You can bounce some of your ideas off me while I'm looking this up.

Fields.MenuText: Well, what if we just use one really big blast to create a tsunami and sink them?
We should just focus fire on their engines and put them down fast.
What if we attack when it's dark? Night could give us the element of surprise.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not how that works. You went to school, right?
Usually that's a good tactic, but you said these Morganas were small and fast. They might be able to out maneuver us.
I'm not positive, but I'm pretty sure Morganas have better night vision than we do.
Well, that was my idea. What do you have?
I, uh... Oh, here it is!
What'd you find?
Something we could use to defeat these Morganas. They shouldn't see it coming.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
So this is your plan, Rawalpindi? False flags?
It's a little more than that. I've got the entire crew working on making me look like a merchant vessel again.
I think the hardest thing to hide will probably be the guns. Maybe we can cover them with crates... and when the Morganas get close we'll shoot through them. Perfect!
The Morganas have been destroying civilian ships, so your idea is to make yourself look like one?
And when they come close, expecting more easy prey, we rip them to shreds. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: It's kind of ingenious.
Sounds overly complicated.
We don't have to tear off any of our armor or anything, right?

Fields.DialogueText: I know, right? You'd be surprised how many engagements were won through deception.
Well, we could just rush in blasting. That's what I'd usually do, but that didn't end very well last time.
No, we're painting over it the best we can. It won't last forever, but we only need to fool them long enough to get close.
You know this is a little crazy, but if it works, I'll be really impressed.
Get ready to be impressed, because this'll work.
I'm starting to believe it.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
We're on our approach. You're sure everything is ready?
Guns are hidden, hull is painted, flags are false. I think we're good.
More importantly, what do you think? Would you believe we're a merchant ship?

Fields.MenuText: Everything looks old, and like we're trying to make money. I think it's perfect.
I think the paint could use a little work. Looks like you got a third grader to do it.
I wouldn't be fooled by any of this. Let's just hope the Morganas will be.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. I remember what being a merchant felt like. This is about as accurate as I could get it.
I wouldn't say that around the crew. They worked really hard to make it look good.
I don't think Morganas are fools, but they shouldn't see something like this coming.
It's time to start our approach.
Fantastic. Everyone, get in your places.
What is everyone wearing? Did you put the crew in costumes?
Not costumes, just out of uniform. We wouldn't exactly pass as merchants otherwise.
I refuse to believe that officer wears that ridiculous hat when he's off duty.
So maybe I gave them some direction. That's what merchants wear. They like to show off how much money they make!
*BOOM*
A warning shot.
The Morganas are approaching. They think we're scared little merchants.
Let's prove otherwise.
@BATTLE
That's all of them! I don't think they'll be setting up anymore blockades here any time soon.
Fantastic job, Rawalpindi.
Oh, stop! Trying to make me blush? Any Belle could've done this.
No other ship could've done this. It had to be you.
What do you mean?
You dress up a warship, paint it whatever color you want, it's still obvious it's a warship. The only reason this worked is because you---
Because I'm not a warship.
Not originally built as one, at least. Good thing, in this case.
So now, I think you deserve a little reward.
Oh? That look in your eye has me excited about what that reward might be...

Fields.MenuText: The same ones? That's impossible.
I guess they didn't get enough of a beating last time!
We could use a little time to recover. Can we avoid them?

Fields.DialogueText: They might be different ones, but how likely does that really seem?
That's the attitude I like to see from my captain. We'll beat them again!
I don't think so. They're coming in fast.
How close are they?
Only a few minutes until the enemy is in range. Your orders?
Prepare for another fight. We won't let them establish their blockade again. We'll scatter them for good.
Aye aye, Captain. By the way, I love it when you get so... serious. Is it strange that I find that exciting?
@BATTLE
Ugh! Not now! Captain, I sense the Morganas are returning!
*ALARM*
All right... That's the last of them... again.
You're sure they're not coming back?
No. Maybe we should just wait a minute before we catch our breath.
How could those Morganas have survived either of those battles?
You know how I fight. They should've been scrap.
Could they have retreated and recovered that quickly? Unless they had reinforcements waiting. The dirty rats.
Fitting name. Morganas and rats have a lot in common. No matter how many times you think you're rid of them, they reappear.
How do you know so much about rats?
As a merchant vessel, I have transported food. On one occasion, I had a bit of a rat infestation. It took far too long to eradicate them completely.

Fields.MenuText: How'd you finally get rid of them?
Well, if the Morganas were the size of rats, I'm pretty sure this war would be a lot easier to finish.
You'd tell me if you still had rats, right?

Fields.DialogueText: A deckhand was getting into the food and leaving it open, and the rats were following the smell onto the ship. We had to get rid of the deckhand to solve the problem.
Yet we still deal with rats to this day, despite them being disease ridden creatures. More likely we'd just ignore the Morganas if they were smaller.
Yes, I'd tell you. And then we'd come up with a plan to completely destroy them. Together.
If only we knew as much about Morganas as we do about rats.
We know what we need to know right now. We know that we can't let them win.
And today, because of us, they haven't.
And tomorrow, if they come back here, we'll just have to teach them another lesson.
That's right. Let's just hope we can move on soon. I'm still really craving that chicken karahi.
Stop talking about it! You're making me hungry!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
It seems like our mission is complete. The Morganas haven't returned.
Great, another victory on our record.
True, but more importantly, we can make port. We can finally enjoy some good spicy food together.
Not just spicy. The spiciest!
A Belle who knows exactly what she wants, and will settle for nothing less! I'm smitten, Rawalpindi.
You know, Captain, I really enjoy fighting by your side. I don't think I'd be doing so well with anybody else.

Fields.MenuText: I feel the same way. You make me a better captain, Rawalpindi.
Where's this coming from? You're not dying are you?
Ha! You're so amazing, I'm pretty sure you'd be fine even without me.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad to hear that you feel the same way I do. Really glad.
No, I'm not dying. I've just been thinking a lot. About you.
I wouldn't be. Without you, I'm pretty sure I wouldn't even be fighting the Morganas anymore. I'd have let myself get reassigned.
Captain, I'm just trying to tell you how much I care about you.
I care about you too.
But I care about you more than just a captain. I want to be more than just a Belle to you. I want to be---
*ALARM*
Dammit! This is not the time!
@BATTLE
We've got another pack of Morganas!
And just when we were about to make port. Let's make this quick.
@BATTLE
Finally, we're here. It feels like it took us forever to reach this moment.
You're telling me. It's been far too long since I've seen home.
You consider India home?
One of them. Bombay and London have both been good to me, in their own ways.
Good to know, but it's hard to concentrate. I'm starving!
Me, too!
I figured you would be after that battle. How about I go grab us some food and hurry right back?
Oh, and get some candles perhaps. And flowers too.

Fields.MenuText: Flowers and candles? Why?
Fantastic idea. It'll really set the mood.
Sounds like a waste of money. We can't eat flowers. Or candles!

Fields.DialogueText: To make everything feel more romantic. This is a date after all.
Exactly. I want our first date to be as romantic as possible.
Come on, that is not the mindset I want you to have during our date, Captain!
Date?! Of course, that's right. You said that before didn't you.
I did. And I meant it. This is an actual date, isn't it, Captain?
I mean... what do you want it to be?
I think I've made that perfectly clear. Now go get our food. I need to go get myself ready.
*ALARM*
*cough*
When you said spicy, you really weren't kidding.
I warned you, didn't I? It isn't too much, is it?

Fields.MenuText: It's a little much, but I'll survive.
It's perfect. Wouldn't change a thing.
This is doing things to my stomach that I'm going to be dealing with for a couple days. I should warn the medical officer.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, after a couple more meals like this, you'll be used to it. Trust me.
That's great to hear. This is just how I like it too.
Oh, well, I'm sorry, I'll make sure it's a little more mild next time.
I wanted everything to be perfect tonight. I've never, uh... done this before.
You don't have to be nervous.
Who says I'm nervous? I'm not nervous. I'm totally fine... Oh, no!
Are you okay?! It got all over you. That's going to stain.
I'm fine, I'm fine! I should probably just deal with this---
*ALARM*
Oh, now that's just perfect!
It's going to be fine, Rawalpindi. The Morganas aren't here yet, you have time to clean up.
You're right. I just need to breathe and take it step by step.
Be quick, the Morganas are on their way.
@BATTLE
Captain, I'm extremely embarrassed.
About what?
About our date. I completely ruined it.

Fields.MenuText: No, it wasn't ruined. I had a wonderful time.
Honestly, I was so drunk, I barely remember it.

Fields.DialogueText: You're just saying that to make me feel better.
You weren't that drunk... were you? How much did you drink?!
I'll admit I was nervous. I wanted everything to be perfect! A night you'd never forget! But... I wasn't exactly sure what I was doing.
Rawalpindi, I'm not going to forget a second that I spend with you. You definitely leave an impression.
A bad one.
Definitely not a bad one.
Captain, you've received an urgent message.
Thank you. From HQ? Maybe it's our next mission.
So much for talking about us. Where are we going this time?
Back. The blockade returned.
What? How many times do we have to defeat them before those Morganas get the message?
At least once more.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
These Morganas keep coming back no matter what.
And I doubt we'll be able to trick them again. Not even Morganas can be that dense.
I think the time for deceptions is over. We need to do what you do best.
And what exactly is that?

Fields.MenuText: Destroy them with reckless abandon.
Look gorgeous.
Run. Run as far from here as possible. Screaming the whole way.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, extra spicy.
Be serious, Captain! But thank you...
Oh please! I have never once run away from a challenge. Don't even joke about that.
We need to make sure they don't come back again, right? The best way I can think to do that is to unleash your inner berserker.
I've been trying to keep that under control since the last time... I messed up and...
Engines damage and wounded personnel are a risk in any combat... but those Morganas were hurt worse. And that's what we need right now, Rawalpindi.
I will trust you, Captain. Let's do this!
But if I start going too far, I want you to pull me back.
We need you to go too far, Rawalpindi. We need you to let loose on those monsters. But I promise, I'll be there with you until the end.
That's all I want. Let's go! Let's give the Morganas something to be afraid of!
@BATTLE
They're still fighting back?! These Morganas are made of sturdier stuff than most.
Just more defenses to peel away before we rip out their hearts.
You know, sometimes you scare me.
Sounds like you need to be less of a baby.

Fields.MenuText: I meant that in a good way.
Ouch. I won't pretend that didn't hurt my feelings a little.
You're probably right about that.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, in that case, feel free to get a little more scared. In a good way!
Then take my advice, because a Morgana victory is what you should truly fear. Nothing else.
Ha! I'm always right, and you need to learn that one, my dear!
I never noticed this, but you don't have much of a censor.
Well, you know you can say whatever you want to me. You don't have to hold yourself back.
I'll keep that in mind. Maybe after this battle I'll tell you I love you.
You'll tell me what?
No time to repeat myself, Captain. We have another volley incoming! Prepare yourselves!
@BATTLE
Whew! That's the last of them... Hopefully for good.
I really don't want to have to fight those particular Morganas again.
And I don't think I want to let myself lose so much control again.
Why not?
That look on your face... I... I said it, didn't I?

Fields.MenuText: No. You didn't say anything.
You mean that you love me? Yeah, you did.
All the sounds of battle were so loud, I could barely hear you. Really.

Fields.DialogueText: That's kind, but don't lie to me. I know I said it.
I knew it. This is horrible, I can't believe I said it!
Really? No, I'm sure you heard it. I know how loud I can be.
It's not the end of the world, Rawalpindi.
This ruins everything. I wasn't supposed to say it like that. I wanted to say it in the most romantic---
I have the same feelings, Rawalpindi. I love you, too.
Now I have to create another perfect moment so that I can--- wait, what did you just say?
I said I feel the same way about you. I love you, Rawalpindi.
Even though I told you while I was in a frenzy?
Just makes me love you more.
Can I just hold you right now and never let go?
Since when do you ask permission?
Good point! And any Morganas that interrupt THIS moment will have hell to pay!
This time together has been wonderful. Was this too much to ask for our first date?
Well, third time's the charm.
This is only our second date though.
Sounds like we're ahead of schedule, then. More wine?
No, I'd rather not risk spilling anything on my clothes this time.

Fields.MenuText: Well, if that happens you could just take them off.
That's probably for the best. We wouldn't want to ruin this perfect date.
Don't worry so much. You're not going to spill anything.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain! I didn't expect you to be so forward!
Exactly. It really has been perfect hasn't it?
Well, now that you've said that I'll definitely spill. So, no thanks.
You know, no perfect date would be complete without a kiss at the end.
Is that a hint that I should kiss you?
Maybe. What do you think?
I'm thinking I better kiss you before something interrupts this perfect moment.
*ALARM*
I blame myself for that.
Well, you can blame me for this.
You... kissed me. Do we really have to go fight Morganas now? Or can we just stay here and do more of that?
Focus, Captain! And don't worry. We can pick this up right after we destroy those Morganas.
*kiss*
@BATTLE
... Well. Where did we leave off?
Huh? Sorry, my ears are still ringing. I didn't-
*kiss*
Oh. Okay. I think I can follow along from here....
